# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's a concise implementation of the `clean_column` function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    return lowercase(replace(strip(col), r"[^a-z0-9]" => "_"))
end
```

This function uses `lowercase` to convert the input string to lowercase, `strip` to remove leading and trailing whitespace, and `replace` with a regular expression (`r"[^a-z0-9]"`) to replace any non-alphanumeric characters (except for underscores) with an underscore. The resulting string will have spaces and hyphens replaced with underscores as well.
